questions.name: Let α,β be the roots of x2+bx+1=0. Then the equation whose roots are -α+1β and -β+1α, is
questions.nameText: Let α,β be the roots of x2+bx+1=0. Then the equation whose roots are -α+1β  and -β+1α, is
questions.solution:
Since α, β are roots of x2+b x+1=0

∴α+β=-b,αβ=1

We have,

-α-1β+-β-1α

=-α+β-1β+1α=-α+β-α+βα β=b+b=2b

and, -α-1β-β-1α=α β+2+1α β=1+2+1=4

Thus, the equation whose roots are -α-1βand-β-1α is

x2-2bx+4=0

questions.name: If the sum of the roots of the equation a+1x2+2a+3x+3a+4=0 is -1, ,then the product of the roots is
questions.nameText: If the sum of the roots of the equation a+1x2+2a+3x+3a+4=0 is -1, ,then the product of the roots is
questions.solution:
Let α,β be the roots of the equation

a+1x2+2a+3x+3a+4=0. .Then,,

α+β=-1⇒-2a+3a+1=-1⇒a=-2

∴ Product of the roots =3a+4a+1=-6+4-2+1=2

questions.name: If a+b+c=0 and a≠c then the roots of the equation b+c-ax2+c+a-bx+a+b-c=0, ,are
questions.nameText: If a+b+c=0 and a≠c then the roots of the equation b+c-ax2+c+a-bx+a+b-c=0, ,are
questions.solution:
Using a+b+c=0, the given equation reduces to ax2+bx+c=0

Clearly, x=1 is a root of this equation

Let D be its discriminant. Then,

D=b2-4ac=-a-c2-4ac=a-c2>0[∵a≠c]

Hence, the roots are real and unequal

questions.name: Number of roots of the equation x-2x-1=1-2x-1 is
questions.nameText: Number of roots of the equation x-2x-1=1-2x-1  is
questions.solution: If x≠1 , multiplying each term by x-1 the given equation reduces to xx-1=(x-1) or x-12=0 or x=1 , which is not possible as considering x≠1 , thus given equation has no roots

questions.name: The number of real roots of the equation x2-3x+2=0 is
questions.nameText: The number of real roots of the equation x2-3x+2=0 is
questions.solution:
We have,

x2-3x+2=0

⇒x-1x-2=0

⇒x=1, 2⇒x=±1,±2

questions.name: The number of real roots of the equation x-12+x-22+x-32=0 is
questions.nameText: The number of real roots of the equation x-12+x-22+x-32=0 is
questions.solution: The equation has no real root, because LHS is always positive while RHS is zero

questions.name: If α and β are the roots of the equation ax2+bx+c=0, (c≠0) ), then the equation whose roots are 1aα+b and 1aβ+b is
questions.nameText: If α and β are the roots of the equation ax2+bx+c=0, (c≠0) ), then the equation whose roots are 1aα+b  and 1aβ+b  is
questions.solution:
Replacing x by 1-bxax we get the required equation

a1-bxax2+b1-bxax+c=0

⇒a1+b2x2-2bx+axb-b2x+ca2x2=0

⇒a+ab2x2-2abx+abx-ab2x2+a2cx2=0

⇒      acx2-bx+1=0

questions.name: If x2+ax+10=0 and x2+bx-10=0 have a common root, then a2-b2 is equal to
questions.nameText: If x2+ax+10=0 and x2+bx-10=0 have a common root, then a2-b2  is equal to
questions.solution:
Let α be a common root of the equations x2+ax+10=0 and x2+bx-10=0. Then,

α2+a α+10=10

and, α2+b α-10=0

Adding and subtracting these two equations, we get

2 α2+αa+b=0 and a-bα+20=0

⇒α=-a+b2 and α=-20a-b

⇒-a+b2=-20a-b⇒a2-b2=40

questions.name: The roots of the equation x2-x-6=x+2 are
questions.nameText: The roots of the equation x2-x-6=x+2 are
questions.solution:
We have,

x2-x-6=x2-x-6, if x≤-2 or x≥3-x2-x-6, if-2<x<3 <

CASE I

Whenx≤-2 or, x≥3

In this case, we have x2-x-6=x2-x-6

∴x2-x-6=x+2

⇒x2-x-6=x+2

⇒x2-2x-8=0

⇒x-4x+2=0

⇒x=-2, 4

CASE II

When-2<x<3

In this case, we have x2-x-6=-(x2-x-6)

x2-x-6=x+2

⇒-x2-x-6=x+2

⇒x2-4=0

⇒x=± 2

⇒x=2[∵2∈(-2, 3)]

Hence, the roots are -2, 2, 4

questions.name: If the equation 2x2-7x+1=0 and ax2+bx+2=0 have a common root, then
questions.nameText: If the equation 2x2-7x+1=0 and ax2+bx+2=0 have a common root, then
questions.solution:
Let α be a common root of the two equations. Then,

2 α2-7 α+1=0

a α2+b α+2=0

⇒α2-14-b=αa-4=12b+7a

⇒a-42b+7a=b+144-a

⇒7a+2bb+14+a-42=0

Clearly, a=4,b=-14 satisfy this equation

questions.name: The number of real roots of the equation x+1x3+x+1x=0 is
questions.nameText: The number of real roots of the equation x+1x3+x+1x=0 is
questions.solution:
x+1x3+x+1x=0

⇒  x+1xx+1x2+1=0

⇒x+1x=0

⇒x2=-1 which is not possible

Hence, no real roots exist

questions.name: If the roots of the equation 3x2-6x+5=0 are α and β , then the equation whose roots are α+β and 2α+β will be
questions.nameText: If the roots of the equation 3x2-6x+5=0 are α and β , then the equation whose roots are α+β and 2α+β  will be
questions.solution:
Here, α+β=2 and αβ=53

Now, α+β+2α+β=2+22=3

And α+β×2α+β=2

∴ Required equation is

x2-α+β+2α+βx+α+β×2α+β=0

⇒   x2-3x+2=0

questions.name: The value of 42+42+42+... is .equal to
questions.nameText: The value of 42+42+42+...  is .equal to
questions.solution:
Let y=42+42+42+…

⇒   y=42+y

On squaring both sides, we get

y2=42+y

⇒y2-y-42=0

⇒y-7y+6=0

⇒  y=7, 6

Since, y=-6 does not satisfy the given equation

∴   The required solution is y=7

questions.name: If α, β are the roots of the equation ax2+bx+c=0 , then αaβ+b+βaα+b is equal to
questions.nameText: If α, β are the roots of the equation ax2+bx+c=0 , then αaβ+b+βaα+b  is equal to
questions.solution:
Since, α+β=-ba and αβ=ca

Also α2+β2=α+β2-2αβ=b2-2aca2

Now, αaβ+b+βaα+b

=aα2+β2+b(α+β)αβa2+abα+β+b2

=ab2-2aca2+b-bacaa2+ab-ba+b2=-2a

questions.name: If the difference of the roots of the equation x2-bx+c=0 be 1, then
questions.nameText: If the difference of the roots of the equation x2-bx+c=0 be 1, then
questions.solution:
Let α and β be the roots of the equation x2-bx+c=0 .

⇒ α+β=b and αβ=c

∴ α-β=α+β2-4αβ

⇒1=b2-4c

⇒b2-4c-1=0

questions.nameText: If the roots of the equation ax2-4x+a2=0 are imaginary and the sum of the roots is equal to their product, then a= =

16-4a3<0 and4a=a

⇒4-a2<0 and a2=4

⇒a3-4>0 and a=± 2⇒a=2

questions.nameText: The roots of the given equation p-qx2+q-rx+r-p=0 are
questions.solution:

p-qx2+q-rx+r-p=0

⇒x=(r-q)±q-r2-4r-p(p-q)2(p-q)

=(r-q)±q2+r2-2qr-4(rp-rq-p2+pq)2(p-q) (

⇒x=r-q±(q+r-2p)2(p-q)

⇒x=r-pp-q,1

questions.name: If x=2+22/3+21/3, then the value of x3-6x2+6x is
questions.nameText: If x=2+22/3+21/3, then the value of x3-6x2+6x is
questions.solution:
We have,

x=2+22/3+21/3 /

⇒x-2=22/3+21/3 /

⇒x-23=22+2+3×22/3×21/3(22/3+21/3)

⇒x3-6x2+12x-8=4+2+3×2×(x-2) )

⇒x3-6x2+6x=2

questions.name: If 3p2=5p+2 and 3q2=5q+2 where p≠q , then the equation whose roots are 3p-2q and 3q-2p is
questions.nameText: If 3p2=5p+2 and 3q2=5q+2 where p≠q , then the equation whose roots are 3p-2q and 3q-2p is
questions.solution:
Since, 3p2=5p+2

⇒p=2, -13

And, 3q2=5q+2 ⇒   q=2, -13

∵p≠q

Here, we assume that p=2 and q=-13

Now, the given roots of the equation are

(3p-2q) and 3q-2pie, 203, -5

Sum of roots=203-5=53

And product of roots=203×-5=-1003

∴ Required equation is

x2-52x-1003=0

⇒3x2-5x-100=0

questions.name: The value of k for which the equation k-2x2+8x+k+4=0 has both roots real, distinct and negative, is
questions.nameText: The value of k for which the equation k-2x2+8x+k+4=0 has both roots real, distinct and negative, is
questions.solution:
Let fx=k-2x2+8x+k+4

If fx=0 has both negative roots, then we must have

(i) Discriminant >0

(ii) Vertex of y=f(x) is on left side of y -axis

(iii) k-2f0>0

Now,

(i) Discriminant >0

⇒64-4k-2k+4>0

⇒k2+2k-24<0⇒-6<k<4 …((i)

(ii) Vertex is on left side of y -axis

⇒-82k-2<0⇒k-2>0⇒k>2 …(ii)

(iii) k-2f0>0

⇒k-2k+4>0⇒k<-4 or k>2 …((iii)

From (i),(ii) and (iii), we obtain k∈2, 4

Hence, k=3

questions.name: The number of real roots of 32x2-7x+7=9 is
questions.nameText: The number of real roots of 32x2-7x+7=9 is
questions.solution:
Given that 32x2-7x+7=32⇒2x2-7x+7=2

⇒2x2+7x+5=0

Now, D=b2-4ac

=-72-4×2×5

=49-40=9>0

Hence, it has two real roots.

questions.name: If one of the roots of the equation x2+bx+3=0 is thrice the other, then b is equal to
questions.nameText: If one of the roots of the equation x2+bx+3=0 is thrice the other, then b is equal to
questions.solution:
Let α and 3α be the roots of the given equation, then

∴ α+3α=4α=-b

And α.3α=3α2=3

⇒ α=±1

∴ b=±4

questions.solution:

=2+5+2-5=2

questions.nameText: The α,β are the roots of the equation x2+ax+b=0 , then 1α2+1β2  is equal to

questions.name: The number of real roots of the equation esinx-e-sinx-4=0 are
questions.nameText: The number of real roots of the equation esinx-e-sinx-4=0 are
questions.solution:
Given equation is esinx-e-sinx-4=0

Let esinx=y , then given equation can be written as

y2-4y-1=0⇒y=2±5

But the value of y=esinx is always positive so we take only y=2+5

⇒loge⁡y=loge⁡(2+5)

⇒sin⁡x=loge⁡2+5>1

Which is impossible since sin⁡x cannot be greater than 1.

Hence, we cannot find any real value of x which satisfies each given equation.

questions.name: If 8, 2 are the roots of x2+ax+β=0, and 3,3 are the roots of x2+α x+b=0, then the roots of x2+ax+b=0 are
questions.nameText: If 8, 2 are the roots of x2+ax+β=0, and 3,3 are the roots of x2+α x+b=0, then the roots of  x2+ax+b=0 are
questions.solution:
Since 8, 2 are roots of x2+ax+β=0 and 3, 3 are roots of x2+α x+b=0. Therefore,

8+2=-a,8×2=β and 3+3=-α,3×3=b

⇒a=-10,β=16,α=-6 and b=9

Thus, x2+ax+b=0, becomes x2-10 x+9=0 whose roots are 1, 9

questions.name: If one root of the equation x2+px+q=0 is 2+3 , then the value of the p and q respectively
questions.nameText: If one root of the equation x2+px+q=0 is 2+3 , then the value of the p and  q respectively
questions.solution:
Since, one root of the equation

x2+px+q=0 is 2+3 , then the other root will be

2-3

∴ Since of roots 2+3+2-3=-p

⇒p=-4

And product of roots

2+32-3=q

⇒q=1

questions.name: If the roots of the equation ax2+bx+c=0 be α and β , then the roots of the equation cx2+bx+a=0 are
questions.nameText: If the roots of the equation ax2+bx+c=0 be α and β , then the roots of the equation cx2+bx+a=0 are
questions.solution:
Since, α and β are the roots of ax2+bx+c=0 .

Then, α+β=-baand αβ=ca

Let the roots of cx2+bx+a=0 beα'', β'', then

α''+ β''=-bcandα''β''=ac

Now, α+βαβ=-baca=-bc

⇒1α+1β=α''+ β''

Hence, α''=1αandβ''= 1β

questions.name: Let a be a complex number such that a<1 and z1, z2,… be vertices of a polygon such that zk=1+a+a2+...+ak-1 . Then the vertices of the polygon lie within a circle is
questions.nameText: Let a be a complex number such that a<1 and z1, z2,… be vertices of a polygon such that zk=1+a+a2+...+ak-1 . Then the vertices of the polygon lie within a circle is
questions.solution:
We have, zk=1+a+a2+...+ak-1=1-ak1-a

⇒ zk-11-a=-ak1-a

⇒ zk-11-a=|ak||1-a|

= |ak||1-a|<1|1-a|    (∵a<1) (

⇒ zk lies within a circle z-11-a=1|1-a|

questions.name: If x≠0,x+12x+13x+12x4x+36x+34x+46x+48x+4 =0, then x+1 is equal to
questions.nameText: If x≠0,x+12x+13x+12x4x+36x+34x+46x+48x+4 =0, then x+1 is equal to
questions.solution:
Givenx+12x+13x+12x4x+36x+34x+46x+48x+4=0

⇒20x2x2x4x+36x+32x+23x+24x+2=0

[Using (R1→2R1-R3)]

⇒20x02x4x+3-2x-32x+23x+2-2x-2=0

[Using (C3→C3-2C2)]

⇒-4x2x2+2x-2x+3x+1=0

⇒-4x2x2+2x-2x2+5x+3=0

⇒4x3x+3=0

⇒x+1=0   [∵x≠0 given]

questions.name: ∆ =1/a1bc1/b1ca1/c1ab=
questions.nameText: ∆ =1/a1bc1/b1ca1/c1ab=
questions.solution:
Applying R3→R3-α R1-R2, we get

∆=bca α+bcdc α+d00a α3+b α2+c α+d

⇒∆=(a α3+b α2+c α+d)(bd-c2)

ax3+bx3+cx+d=0

questions.name: If A=3424, B=-2-20-2 , then A+B-1 is equal to
questions.nameText: If A=3424, B=-2-20-2 , then A+B-1  is equal to
questions.solution:
Now, A+B=3424+-2-20-2=1222

⇒ A+B=1222=2-4=-2

Also, adjA+B=2-2-21

∴A+B-1=-122-2-21

=-111-1/2

A-1=144-4-23 and B-1=14-220-2

∴A-1+B-1=1-1-1/23/4+-1/21/20-1/2

=1/2-1/2-1/21/4

∴ A+B-1≠A-1+B-1

questions.name:

x+y+z=1

x+2y+4z=α

Is consistent, are
questions.nameText:
The values of α for which the system of equations

x+y+z=1 

x+2y+4z=α 

x+4y+10z=α2 

Is consistent, are
questions.solution:
Let A=1111241410, B=1αα2 and X=xyz

For consistent, A=1111241410=0

⇒  120-16-110-4+14-2=0

⇒  4-6+2=0

⇒  0=0

and adj AB=O

⇒   4-62-69-32-311αα2=000

⇒  4-6α+2α2-6+9α-3α22-3α+α2=000

⇒ 2α2-6α+4=0, -3α2+9α-6=0

and α2-3α+2=0

Now, 2α2-6α+4=0

⇒  2α–2α–2=0

⇒  α=1, 2

Similarly from other equations we also get the same value

questions.name: A=0     3      3-3    0 -4-3    4      0 and B=xyz, thenB''AB is
questions.nameText: A=0     3      3-3    0 -4-3    4      0 and B=xyz, thenB''AB is
questions.solution:
AB=0     3     3-3    0 -4-3    4     0xyz=3y+3z-3x-4z-3x+4y

Now, B''AB=x y z3y+3z-3x-4z-3x+4y

=3xy+3zx-3xy-4yz-3xz+4yz

=0

∴B''(AB) is a null matrix.

questions.name: If matrix A=32412-1011 and A-1=1kadj A , ,then k is
questions.nameText: If matrix A=32412-1011  and A-1=1kadj A , ,then k is
questions.solution:
Given that, A=32412-1011

and A-1=1kadj A

⇒  k=|A|

=32412-1011

=32+1-21-0+41-0

=9-2+4=11

questions.name: The rank of the matrix 1236242833170235 is
questions.nameText: The rank of the matrix 1236242833170235  is
questions.solution:
Let A=1236242833170235. Then,,

A ~1230242033100230 By applying R4→R4-R3-R2-R1

⇒A ~100020-403-3-800230By applying R2→R2-2 R1,R3→R3-3 R1

We observe that the leading minor of the third order of this matrix is non-zero i.e.

12300-30-4-8=-12≠0. Hence, rank A=3

questions.name: If A is singular matrix, then A adj (A)
questions.nameText: If A is singular matrix, then A adj (A)
questions.solution:
Given that A is a singular matrix

∴ A=0

∵ A adj A=A=0

∴A adj A is a zero matrix

=-3         414  -13
